TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit EffectFactory extends Java.Lang.Object

Docs.summary: The EffectFactory class defines the list of available Effects, and provides functionality to inspect and instantiate them.

remarks.para: The EffectFactory class defines the list of available Effects, and provides functionality to inspect and instantiate them. Some effects may not be available on all platforms, so before creating a certain effect, the application should confirm that the effect is supported on this platform by calling .

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(native int javaReference, valuetype Android.Runtime.JniHandleOwnership transfer) cil managed

Docs.param: A containing a Java Native Interface (JNI) object reference.
Docs.summary: A constructor used when creating managed representations of JNI objects; called by the runtime.

remarks.para: This constructor is invoked by the runtime infrastructure () to create a new managed representation for a Java Native Interface object.
The constructor will initializes the property of the new instance using and .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Android.Media.Effect.Effect CreateEffect(string effectName) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the effect to create.
Docs.summary: Instantiate a new effect with the given effect name.

remarks.para: Instantiate a new effect with the given effect name.
The effect's parameters will be set to their default values.

Note that the EGL context associated with the current EffectContext need not be made current when creating an effect. This allows the host application to instantiate effects before any EGL context has become current.

Docs.exception: if the effect with the specified name is not supported or not known.

tr.td: Float, between 0 and 1. Zero means no adjustment, while 1 indicates the maximum amount of adjustment.
Float, between 0 and 1. Zero means no adjustment, while 1 indicates the maximum amount of adjustment.

remarks.para: Attempts to auto-fix the image based on histogram equalization.

tr.td: A URI for the background video to use. This parameter must be supplied before calling apply() for the first time.
A URI for the background video to use. This parameter must be supplied before calling apply() for the first time.

remarks.para: Replaces the background of the input frames with frames from a selected video. Requires an initial learning period with only the background visible before the effect becomes active. The effect will wait until it does not see any motion in the scene before learning the background and starting the effect.
If the update listener is set for this effect using , it will be called when the effect has finished learning the background, with a null value for the info parameter.
Overlays a bitmap (with premultiplied alpha channel) onto the input image. The bitmap is stretched to fit the input image.

tr.td: The value of the minimal pixel.
The value of the maximal pixel.
The value of the minimal pixel.
The value of the maximal pixel.

remarks.para: Adjusts the range of minimal and maximal color pixel intensities.

tr.td: Positive float. 1.0 means no change; larger values will increase brightness.
Positive float. 1.0 means no change; larger values will increase brightness.

remarks.para: Adjusts the brightness of the image.

tr.td: Float. 1.0 means no change; larger values will increase contrast.
Float. 1.0 means no change; larger values will increase contrast.

remarks.para: Adjusts the contrast of the image.

tr.td: Integer, between 0 and width of the image.
Integer, between 0 and height of the image.
The width of the cropped image.
Integer, between 1 and the width of the image minus xorigin.
The height of the cropped image.
Integer, between 1 and the height of the image minus yorigin.
Integer, between 0 and width of the image.
Integer, between 0 and height of the image.
The width of the cropped image.
Integer, between 1 and the width of the image minus xorigin.
The height of the cropped image.
Integer, between 1 and the height of the image minus yorigin.

remarks.para: Crops an upright rectangular area from the image. If the crop region falls outside of the image bounds, the results are undefined.
Applies a cross process effect on image, in which the red and green channels are enhanced while the blue channel is restricted.
Applies black and white documentary style effect on image..

tr.td: Integer, representing an ARGB color with 8 bits per channel. May be created using class.
Integer, representing an ARGB color with 8 bits per channel. May be created using class.
Integer, representing an ARGB color with 8 bits per channel. May be created using class.
Integer, representing an ARGB color with 8 bits per channel. May be created using class.

remarks.para: Representation of photo using only two color tones.

tr.td: Float, between 0 and 1. Zero means no change.
Float, between 0 and 1. Zero means no change.

remarks.para: Applies back-light filling to the image.

tr.td: Float, between 0 and 1. Zero means no distortion.
Float, between 0 and 1. Zero means no distortion.

remarks.para: Applies a fisheye lens distortion to the image.

tr.td: The strength of the grain effect.
Float, between 0 and 1. Zero means no change.
The strength of the grain effect.
Float, between 0 and 1. Zero means no change.

remarks.para: Applies film grain effect to image.
Applies lomo-camera style effect to image.

tr.td: Multiple center points (x, y) of the red eye regions.
An array of floats, where (f[2*i], f[2*i+1]) specifies the center of the i'th eye. Coordinate values are expected to be normalized between 0 and 1.
Multiple center points (x, y) of the red eye regions.
An array of floats, where (f[2*i], f[2*i+1]) specifies the center of the i'th eye. Coordinate values are expected to be normalized between 0 and 1.

remarks.para: Removes red eyes on specified region.

tr.td: The angle of rotation in degrees.
Integer value. This will be rounded to the nearest multiple of 90.
The angle of rotation in degrees.
Integer value. This will be rounded to the nearest multiple of 90.

remarks.para: Rotates the image. The output frame size must be able to fit the rotated version of the input image. Note that the rotation snaps to a the closest multiple of 90 degrees.

tr.td: Float, between -1 and 1. 0 means no change, while -1 indicates full desaturation, i.e. grayscale.
Float, between -1 and 1. 0 means no change, while -1 indicates full desaturation, i.e. grayscale.
Float, between 0 and 1. 0 means no change.
Float, between 0 and 1. 0 means no change.

remarks.para: Rotates the image according to the specified angle, and crops the image so that no non-image portions are visible.

tr.td: Float, between 0 and 1, with 0 indicating cool, and 1 indicating warm. A value of of 0.5 indicates no change.
Float, between 0 and 1, with 0 indicating cool, and 1 indicating warm. A value of of 0.5 indicates no change.

remarks.para: Adjusts color temperature of the image.

tr.td: Integer, representing an ARGB color with 8 bits per channel. May be created using class.
Integer, representing an ARGB color with 8 bits per channel. May be created using class.

remarks.para: Tints the photo with specified color.

tr.td: Float, between 0 and 1. 0 means no change.
Float, between 0 and 1. 0 means no change.

remarks.para: Adds a vignette effect to image, i.e. fades away the outer image edges.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig bool IsEffectSupported(string effectName) cil managed

Docs.summary: Check if an effect is supported on this platform.

remarks.para: Check if an effect is supported on this platform.
Some effects may only be available on certain platforms. Use this method before instantiating an effect to make sure it is supported.

Docs.exception: if the effect name is not known.

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which contains the java.lang.Class JNI value corresponding to this type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control which jclass is provided to methods like .

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.
